titlestmt.titleproper: Steve Ryfle "Desegregating Hollywood" Interview Collection, 1999-2019, bulk 2008-2011 COL 31
titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to His Holdings at the Indiana University Black Film Center/Archive
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ronda L. Sewald

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-07-02 04:01:44 -0400.

physdesc.extent: 205 audio files (WAV MP3) (193 hours) : mono + 15 magazine issues documentation(Approximately)(Approximately)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following three series:

list.item: Series 2. Interviews for Bill Gunn research, 1973-2011, bulk 2009-2011
Series 3. Shock Cinema issues featuring Ryfle interviews, 1999-2015

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Steve Ryfle to the Indiana University Black Film Center/Archive in June 2019

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Materials may be used in-house at the BFC/A; duplication and further distribution permitted only with permission of the donor and archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [item], Steve Ryfle "Desegregating Hollywood" Interview Collection (COL 31), Black Film Center/Archive, Indiana University, Bloomington.

controlaccess.subject: African Americans in the motion picture industry
African American actresses
African American actors
African American motion picture producers and directors
Race in motion pictures
Civil rights movements in motion pictures

did.unittitle: Steve Ryfle lecture at University of Wisconsin, Madison

scopecontent.head: Interviewee Biography
scopecontent.p: Actor and costume designer for the film Super Fly. More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0011239/

scopecontent.head: Interviewee Biography
scopecontent.p: Head writer for Sanford and Son in the early 1970s. More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0011814/

scopecontent.head: Interviewee Biography
scopecontent.p: Screenwriter of Truck Turner (1974, starring Isaac Hayes) and Enter the Dragon (1973, starring Jim Kelly). More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0021363/

scopecontent.head: Interviewee Biography
scopecontent.p: Former NFL player and one of the first (perhaps the first) African-American film producers in Hollywood. He produced Melinda (1972, starring Calvin Lockhart). More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0040641/

scopecontent.head: Interviewee Biography
scopecontent.p: Director of Cleopatra Jones and the Casino of Gold, sequel to the popular Cleopatra Jones, starring Tamara Dobson. More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0047094/

scopecontent.head: Interviewee Biography
scopecontent.p: Assistant director of Super Fly, Honeybaby, Honeybaby, Aaron Loves Angela, and other films and television series. One of the first Black members of the Directors' Guild of America. More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0048670/

scopecontent.head: Interviewee Biography
scopecontent.p: Assistant director of Super Fly, Honeybaby, Honeybaby, Aaron Loves Angela, and other films and television series. One of the first Black members of the Directors' Guild of America. More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0048670/

scopecontent.p: A Los Angeles journalist who covered the Black film boom in the early 1970s and befriended Jim Brown and others.

scopecontent.p: Legendary actress and singer who starred in the groundbreaking sitcom Julia. More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0140792/

scopecontent.head: Interviewee Biography
scopecontent.p: Popular character actor who guest starred on dozens of prime-time TV shows in the 1960s and 70s, and is best known for his starring role in Battlestar Galactica. More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0141956/

scopecontent.head: Interviewee Biography
scopecontent.p: Poet and novelist from Los Angeles, became one of the first African-American women to write for primetime television when she penned an episode of NBC's The Name of the Game at age 19. More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1719967/

scopecontent.head: Interviewee Biography
scopecontent.p: Producer of "Blaxploitation" films for MGM in the early 1970s including Cool Breeze and Hit Man. More information: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0180020/

did.unittitle: Series 3. Shock Cinema issues featuring Ryfle interviews,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Piece by Ryfle: "The Last Action Hero: Shock Cinema Talks with Fred Williamson," pages 3-7.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Pieces by Ryfle: "The Second Time Around: For Actor Julius W. Harris: Life Begins Anew at 40," pages 3-6 and "The Man Behind 'The Mack': An Interview with Director Michael Campus," pages 36-38. Also contains an interview with Marilyn Joi by Chris Poggiali.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Piece by Ryfle: "Life Is a Toilet: The Films of Director Paul Morrissey," pages 18-21, and "Black Actress on the Make!: Carol Speed," pages 23-25.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Piece by Ryfle: "Surviving the Game: An Interview with Writer-Director Oscar Williams," pages 34-36, 47.

odd.head: General

odd.head: General
odd.p: No pieces by Ryfle. Contains an interview with Bill Duke by Nicanor Loreti.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Piece by Ryfle: "Pretty 'Fly' for an Old White Guy: An Interview with Sig Shore," pages 8-11, 46. Also contains an interview with Bob Minor by David Konow.

odd.head: General
